review_title: Good place to get started but not recommended for long term
pros: I have met some great life time friends here. It is a family environment that has multiple events a year that allows family to join. When I was first hired and had to come in for appointments, such as see the nurse or go to HR to sign papers , I was told that I could bring my son because they knew that I am a single mom and that his daycare was  not set up yet.
cons: The culture at Methodist is negative. If you are a person, such as myself, that lets bad vibes bring you down , then this is probably not the place for you. I have also noticed a trend of hiring foreign nurses that have never worked in the U.S and have limited English skills. This has become an issue on numerous occasions due to communication difficulties and cultural differences.

job_title: Supply Chain Tech I in Dallas, TX
pros: Always something to do.  Not much micro-managing. Overall, coworkers were nice.  Great benefits.  Just make sure that whatever doctor you go to is a Methodist provider.  Just because a doctor accepts United Healthcare doesn't mean they are a "Methodist provider."  Very annoying.
cons: Management was poor. One manager would have random days when she would panic for no reason and micro manage everyone constantly.  She would make decisions that didn't make any sense.  Did not like confrontation so either things went on without being dealt with or she would have an assistant or higher level tech pass on messages to us.  Favoritism was a major problem here as well.

review_title: Overall a pretty good place to work.
pros: Great co-workers.  Company is very supportive and encouraging with higher educational opportunities.  Allow for flexible schedules and job-share options.  Multiple committees to join.
cons: Too many "layers" of management and some issues with micromanagement.  So-so benefits and pay is not competitive with other health care systems when looking at nursing positions outside of the bedside nurse role.

job_title: Health Information Employee in Omaha, NE
pros: Easy to get hired with no experience.  Hours for most employees are good. No need to spend much money on clothes here.
cons: Employees may have very different experiences in the way theyre treated. Organization is poor, there are no real training processes in place, and many different people will tell you to do the same thing differently. If confronted about this type of conflict, it takes days to arrive at a resolution, if ever. Employees have overheard petty criticisms of themselves or other employees when management or DIAs thought no one was listening and therefore don't feel comfortable going to management with issues.

review_title: Worked there for 20 years and was fired for a very petty thing.
pros: The pay was okay but had not had a raise since about 2008.
cons: Horrible management,  Micromanage all areas..  Kept track of everything you did all day long.  Is a revolving doors of employees.  Don't plan on staying there til retirment because once you are at top of pay scale they will do whatever they can to get rid of you.  There are many like me out there.  They are more concerned with building buildings than employees.  They have no employee loyalty whatsoever.  Benefits were getting cut the last few years.  No pay raises.

review_title: Great company, however would not work for again.
job_title: Corp Insurance Reimbursement in Omaha, NE
pros: The company itself does try to abide by 'the meaning of care' slogan. Decent benefits. Flexible schedule.
cons: In the billing office there is not online resources system so you learn to do your job based on who you make friends with. There is a lot of bullying by leads directed at the workers directly below and that trickles down to co-workers so it can become very easy for you to become 'the black sheep'.  However, I have seen the management do the same thing to leads so maybe if that stopped leads would become better to the people underneath them.

review_title: So happy I chose to work for this Hospital!  And they choose me!
pros: Excellent orientation until I am secure and confident.  Excellent training by the best.  Super health care benefits for full time (24+) hours.  Very good communication.  Emphasis in Patient care.  The patient is obviously the top priority.  The patient beds are out of this world!  Supportive employee website.
cons: Some floors have been remodeled with current decor.  I'm just waiting for our floor to be updated...  Employee parking garage not completed.  Some areas a little dated.

review_title: I see myself retiring with this company
pros: Great health insurance, many different areas within the company for either advancement or to change direction of career path. I feel like I accomplish something everyday that contributes to the growth of the organization.
cons: Middle management can be unapproachable at times, making productive employees feel insignificant and treating those who come to work to socialize like royalty. It would also help if Supervisors knew what the duties of their employees were, thus eliminating any confusion and stress when a situation becomes overly stressful.

pros: The NICU team is FABULOUS & FRIENDLY!  Everyone helps when you have an admission and is very approachable whenever you have a question.  The assignments are totally appropriate and manageable.  There are a lot lot of opportunities to work overtime (which means serious big bucks and bonuses like I've never seen before!) because we are such a popular hospital.  The environment is clean and new.  The aides are helpful.  The doctors and nurse practioners are respectful and nice to work with.  If I had a baby I would want them to be in this NICU because there are so many highly qualified, highly intelligent, and experienced nurses who work here.  I worked at Children's before this (most of the NICU nurses there worked there before they wised up and came to Women's) and I nearly left nursing because Children's NICU was such a hostile place, a total dog-eat-dog world, lots of condescending nurse-bullies, mega-stress assignments, and very poorly managed place).  If you want to work in a NICU I strongly suggest you look at Methodist; you will not regret your decision!
cons: The new unit is not slated to include a lactation room. At this point in my life I think I'm done having kids but I do feel sorry for the younger nurses who could use the lactation room. Plus, it seems a little backwards to be a Women's Hospital and not offer that.  They also require you to use your PTO if you want to get paid during maternity leave.  We do not have a ton of education opportunities thrown in our face but they are there if you just look online.  No raises for unit committee members or if you obtain any special NICU certifications (ie RNC).

pros:
reputable company
friendly and diverse associates
lots new locations, and state of the art womens hospital
listings of within company job openings
cons:
sometimes bad communication between management levels and employees, 
sometimes too many departments within Management for which one manager is responsible

job_title: STaff Registered Nurse in San Antonio, TX
pros: Worked here for about 9 months now. Great place to work. People you work with are awesome, always offering to help,  willing to listen to your concerns. They are very rewarding, and always giving you recognition.
cons: Can be very short staffed at times especially on weekends no one wants to work. Haven't been here a year yet, but everyone says the pay sucks that you don't get good raises.

pros: Flexible hours are nice to have
cons: Management is very rude to new employees and does not listen to concerns. Systems are impossible to learn, even written notes and documentation are dismissed as “excuses” when managers change their minds after the fact. Managers often bicker over who has authority, so regardless of whose instruction you take it will be wrong. Even re-using existing processes is considered an error when the Lead who wrote it has retired and the new Lead does not like the way it is written and wants it done a different way but does not communicate the changes.

pros: Very well run company.  Administration is very responsive to employees, benefits are excellent, you can work as much or as little as you want - very flexible.  Overall an great company to work for.
cons: Some managers are less than friendly but this can be found anywhere.

pros: Methodist Health System has a supportive work environment with friendly co-workers, tuition reimbursement incentives, and a flexible Family Medical leave option.
cons: Methodist Health System offers little incentives for causual employees, such as paid time off accumulation, and inclusion in the company's bonus payouts.

pros:
Great people to work with
People friendly
Decent pay
Excellent PTO 
Good Health Benefits (if you see Methodist Providers)
cons:
No overtime
Expected to do more work with less time
Employees not always valued (based on job)
Have to play politics to get ahead in job

review_title: Methodist is a great place to work!!!
pros: Methodist is a great place to work, staff is friendly at all levels. The benefit package is fantastic and very reasonable. Pay is in the mid to upper end in most positions. Friendly environment, with a strong support staff around you. Methodist also has plenty of opportunity for advancement.
cons: Not too many Monday thru Friday jobs. It seems everybody works some sort of weekend combination.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Omaha, NE
pros:
- Flexible hours
- Differential pay for evening and weekend
- Variety of work:  main pharmacy, IV room, med rec depending on skill and experience
cons:
- Short-staffed shifts can be frustrating
- Not everything is managed via computer, so some printouts take a while to learn

pros: -Leaving the smelly, old building they work in  (corporate) gives you something to look forward to.
cons:
-They will drop you like a hot potato if they want to save even ten cents.
-They see no value in Information Technology skills and techniques being applied in a Financial arena.
-The managers will not fix health problems:  The Controller of Finance (2017) would not fix a sewer gas leak that was poisoning the employees on that floor.
-They elinate as many men from the workforce as possible, turning "hard science" departments like Accounting/Finance into large groups of syncophantic females.

review_title: Pay is low and supervisors are not great.
pros: Coworkers are great. It's a nice place, and the physicians are generally easy to work for. Sometimes drug reps bring lunches in which is a huge benefit.
cons: Expected to perform flawlessly while short staffed. No raises or room for advancement. It's very easy to get written up.

pros: Professional intelligent compassionate people.  I would only send my family here..
cons: Low pay and new employees make nearly as much as experience..

pros: Large Health System so there is a lot of potential to transfer and grow. Good benefit package.
cons: Pay Increases are very small and not based on performance so that hard workers get the same increases as slackers.

pros: a great group of co-workers and doctors, everyone is friendly for the most part, once you get your foot in the door, it is easy to transfer departments

pros: Work 24 hours per week and get full time benefits. Health insurance was reasonably priced and pretty good coverage.
